title: PRM-PRO-0021: release workflow parity with rvl
description:
Bring profile release automation to rvl-level standards (tag-driven GitHub Release + artifacts).

## Acceptance Criteria
- GitHub workflow builds release artifacts for supported targets from semantic version tags.
- Release notes/changelog generation runs from repository history with no manual edits for standard releases.
- Workflow is tag-gated, retry-safe, and emits actionable failure messages.

## Notes
Keep implementation consistent with rvl/shape/lock conventions where possible.
Homebrew/tap publishing parity is tracked separately.

title: PRM-PRO-0020: push/pull data-fabric wrappers
description:
Implement deferred network subcommands `profile push` / `profile pull` as thin data-fabric wrappers.

## Acceptance Criteria
- push publishes frozen profile payload and reports success/failure deterministically.
- pull fetches profile by ID and writes to output directory with validation.
- Transport and server errors map to refusal envelopes (exit 2).

## Notes
Deferred scope; avoid blocking v0.1 local profile workflows.

title: PRM-PRO-0009: lint against dataset
description:
Implement `profile lint <PROFILE> --against <DATASET>` profile-vs-dataset checks.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Verifies referenced include_columns and key columns exist in dataset header.
- Returns exit 1 (ISSUES_FOUND) for lint findings and exit 0 when clean.
- Dataset parse failures/refusals use structured refusal envelopes (exit 2).

## Notes
Combines validate + dataset-aware checks.

title: PRM-PRO-0023: AGENTS.md + swarm coordination contract
description:
Create/upgrade AGENTS.md in profile with explicit multi-agent operating rules aligned to project standards.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Includes read-rules-first kickoff, br workflow, and no-communication-purgatory guidance.
- Includes reservation rule: reserve only specific files, never broad globs/directories.
- Includes guidance for handling expected local changes from other agents without panic/revert.

## Notes
This bead is documentation/process only; no runtime behavior changes.

title: PRM-PRO-0003: Refusal system + envelope
description:
Implement refusal system and envelope output for profile.v0.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Refusal codes implemented: E_INVALID_SCHEMA, E_MISSING_FIELD, E_BAD_VERSION, E_ALREADY_FROZEN, E_IO, E_CSV_PARSE, E_EMPTY, E_COLUMN_NOT_FOUND.
- Per-code detail payloads match plan contract.
- Refusal envelope emitted on stdout with exit code 2.

## Notes
Non-goal: command-specific business logic beyond mapping errors to refusal payloads.

title: PRM-PRO-0005: stats command implementation
description:
Implement `profile stats <DATASET>` deterministic structural stats for CSV.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Reports column counts, null rates, and key viability in deterministic column order.
- Supports human and --json output.
- CSV parse/empty-data failures map to refusal codes.

## Notes
Core analysis primitive used by suggest-key and lint diagnostics.

title: PRM-PRO-0014: witness append policy
description:
Implement ambient witness append behavior for eligible subcommands + --no-witness.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Witness records are appended for freeze/validate/lint/stats/suggest-key only.
- `--no-witness` suppresses witness writes without changing domain exit semantics.
- output_hash/input metadata follow plan rules per subcommand class.

## Notes
list/show/diff/draft/push/pull should not emit witness records in v0.1.

title: PRM-PRO-0019: --schema output
description:
Implement `--schema` output for profile YAML schema (deferred scope).

## Acceptance Criteria
- `--schema` prints valid JSON Schema and exits 0 before input validation.
- Schema captures draft and frozen variants with required/optional fields.
- Regression test validates schema structure and key constraints.

## Notes
Deferred but useful parallel lane for swarm.

title: PRM-PRO-0024: README parity with rvl style
description:
Upgrade README to rvl-level usability: friendly purpose-first intro, quickstart, real examples, and technical reference.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Top section clearly answers what/why/how with one copy-paste quickstart.
- Includes at least one draft-to-freeze real workflow example and expected outputs.
- Technical depth (flags, refusals, witness behavior) is organized in lower sections.

## Notes
Keep concise but complete for first-time and advanced users.

title: PRM-PRO-0026: stats/suggest/freeze test suites
description:
Implement focused tests for stats, suggest-key, and freeze deterministic behavior.

## Acceptance Criteria
- stats/suggest-key outputs and ranking tie-breaks are deterministic.
- freeze canonicalization/default-fill/hash behavior is validated with golden assertions.
- Exit contract 0/2 and refusal payloads are asserted for parse/empty/version/frozen errors.

## Notes
Witness append behavior remains in witness-focused bead.

title: PRM-PRO-0027: list/show/diff/describe test suites
description:
Implement focused tests for resolver and read/report command contracts.

## Acceptance Criteria
- list/show resolution follows v0.1 scope (path-first, then ~/.epistemic/profiles/).
- diff exits 0 for equivalent profiles and 1 for semantic differences with deterministic report ordering.
- --describe emits operator manifest before input validation and matches documented fields.

## Notes
No witness/refusal matrix duplication here.

title: PRM-PRO-0006: suggest-key ranking
description:
Implement `profile suggest-key <DATASET>` deterministic key candidate ranking.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Ranks candidates by uniqueness/null-rate/stability signals deterministically.
- Supports --top N and --json outputs.
- Tie-breaking is deterministic and documented in output.

## Notes
Can reuse stats primitives but must expose dedicated ranking output contract.

title: PRM-PRO-0004: draft new implementation
description:
Implement `profile draft new` for blank draft generation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- `draft new --format csv --out <FILE>` writes a valid draft YAML template.
- Output is deterministic and schema-valid.
- Invalid format arguments refuse with clear error mapping.

## Notes
v0.1 only requires CSV format support.

title: PRM-PRO-0010: freeze canonicalization + hash
description:
Implement `profile freeze` canonicalization and immutable hash semantics.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Fills defaults (hashing.sha256 and equivalence.order=order-invariant) before canonicalization.
- Computes profile_sha256 over canonicalized payload and writes frozen profile with profile_id `<family>.v<version>`.
- Refuses freezing already-frozen profiles and invalid family/version syntax or integer constraints.

## Notes
v0.1 does not enforce registry-wide monotonicity across historical versions; that is deferred with push/pull workflows.

title: PRM-PRO-0017: draft command test suites
description:
Implement focused tests for draft subcommands (draft new + draft init).

## Acceptance Criteria
- draft new emits schema-valid deterministic CSV template and rejects unsupported formats.
- draft init produces include_columns in header order; key behavior covers explicit key, --key auto, and no-candidate fallback.
- Exit contract and output snapshots are asserted for success/refusal cases.

## Notes
Other command families are covered by dedicated test beads (schema/lint, stats/suggest/freeze, list/show/diff/describe, witness/refusal).

title: PRM-PRO-0016: fixture corpus
description:
Build test fixture corpus for profile command and dataset scenarios.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Fixture set includes valid/invalid draft/frozen YAML profiles and CSV datasets with key/no-key/duplicates/missing columns.
- Fixture README documents intended usage per test family.
- Fixture contents are deterministic and reusable across unit/integration tests.

## Notes
Data-only bead; no runtime logic changes.

title: PRM-PRO-0018: witness/refusal test suites
description:
Implement witness and refusal integration tests for profile CLI.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Witness append/no-witness behavior tested across eligible and ineligible subcommands.
- witness query/last/count behavior tested against synthetic ledgers.
- Refusal envelope shape and detail payloads tested for all refusal codes.

## Notes
Integration-level assertion bead; avoid duplicating core command correctness tests.

title: PRM-PRO-0028: Homebrew/tap release parity
description:
Implement Homebrew/tap publishing parity for profile release flow if required by distribution strategy.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Release workflow updates tap metadata/formula (or equivalent) from released artifacts.
- Version bump and checksum update are deterministic and reproducible.
- Failure modes are explicit with actionable retry guidance.

## Notes
Deferred until core release workflow (PRM-PRO-0021) is stable.

title: PRM-PRO-0025: schema+lint test suites
description:
Implement focused tests for validate/lint behavior.

## Acceptance Criteria
- validate paths: valid draft/frozen pass; malformed/missing-field inputs refuse with correct code/detail.
- lint paths: missing columns/keys report ISSUES_FOUND (exit 1), parser/input problems refuse (exit 2).
- Human and --json output contracts are asserted with stable snapshots.

## Notes
Scope excludes stats/suggest/freeze and witness tests (covered by separate beads).

title: PRM-PRO-0012: diff command
description:
Implement `profile diff <A> <B>` structural diff command.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Diffs two resolved profiles and reports field-level differences deterministically.
- Exit 1 when differences exist; exit 0 when equivalent.
- Supports human and --json output modes.

## Notes
Uses resolution behavior from list/show bead.

title: PRM-PRO-0015: witness query CLI
description:
Implement `profile witness query|last|count` subcommands.

## Acceptance Criteria
- query/last/count commands read ledger and support expected filters/options.
- Human and --json output supported with deterministic ordering.
- Empty/no-match behavior follows witness conventions and documented exits.

## Notes
Depends on witness ledger model from PRM-PRO-0014.

title: PRM-PRO-0008: validate command
description:
Implement `profile validate <FILE>` schema validation command.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Valid profile exits 0; schema violations refuse with exit 2 and structured details.
- Supports human and --json outputs.
- Handles both draft and frozen profile forms correctly.

## Notes
Schema-only validation (no dataset checks).

title: PRM-PRO-0002: Profile schema model + parser
description:
Implement profile YAML schema models (draft + frozen) and serialization/parsing layer.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Typed structs for schema_version/status/format/key/include_columns/equivalence/hashing/profile_id/profile_sha256/frozen.
- Draft and frozen validations enforce required fields and valid enums.
- Canonical read/write path produces deterministic field ordering for downstream hashing.

## Notes
Foundation bead for validate/freeze/diff/show/list.

title: PRM-PRO-0007: draft init implementation
description:
Implement `profile draft init <DATASET>` header-driven draft generation for CSV.

## Acceptance Criteria
- include_columns populated from dataset header in file order.
- `--key <COLUMN>` sets explicit key; `--key auto` uses top suggest-key candidate.
- Draft defaults include float_decimals=6 and trim_strings=true; order/hashing omitted until freeze.

## Notes
Depends on CSV parsing and suggest-key behavior for auto mode.

title: PRM-PRO-0022: CI quality gates + test matrix
description:
Establish CI baseline comparable to rvl standards for build correctness and regression safety.

## Acceptance Criteria
- CI runs formatting/lint/type checks and test suite on pull_request and push to main.
- Matrix dimensions (OS/toolchain) are explicit and intentionally scoped for runtime budget.
- Failing jobs print local reproduction commands in logs or job summary.

## Notes
Keep runtime bounded; avoid excessive matrix fan-out for early-stage repo.

title: PRM-PRO-0001: Scaffold crate + CLI surface
description:
Build crate skeleton and clap CLI surface for profile subcommands and global flags.

## Acceptance Criteria
- src/main.rs + src/lib.rs present with run() -> u8 exit mapping.
- CLI command tree includes draft/validate/lint/stats/suggest-key/freeze/list/show/diff/witness.
- Global flags wire-up: --describe, --schema (stub allowed), --version, --no-witness.

## Notes
Boundary: command plumbing only; business logic in follow-up beads.

title: PRM-PRO-0011: list/show resolution
description:
Implement profile resolution + `list` + `show` commands for v0.1.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Resolution order supports file path first, then profile-id search in `~/.epistemic/profiles/` (v0.1 scope).
- `list` returns deterministic ordering; `show` renders resolved profile (human + --json).
- Missing profiles return structured refusal.

## Notes
Built-ins and `EPISTEMIC_PROFILE_PATH` are explicitly deferred in v0.1.

title: PRM-PRO-0013: operator manifest + --describe
description:
Implement operator manifest and `--describe` command path.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Embedded operator.json reflects profile command capabilities/exit/refusal map.
- `--describe` prints manifest and exits 0 before input validation.
- Manifest fields align with docs/PLAN.md operator section.

## Notes
Non-goal: network push/pull manifest details beyond v0.1.
